content: repeat 5x p k4 p w row 39 s k repeat 5x k4 k row 40 repeat 4x p k4 p w row 41 s k repeat 4x k4 k row 42 repeat 3x p k4 p w row 43 s k repeat 3x k4 k row 44 repeat 2x p k4 p w row 45 s k repeat 2x k4 k row 46 p k4 p w row 47 s k k4 k row 48 repeat 6x p k4 repeat 4x p k3 repeat 4x p k2 repeat 4x p k1 p k7 3 needles bind off to join the two edges pass a needle through 74-75 using a third needle knit after 4-5 cast off stitches turn and stick it inside as better keep on pulling the end tail stitches of the first row top together the first stitches of front the tail end inside out shown on this octopus tentacle shown in the yellow box from time needle on the picture folder and back needles knit together to time whilst progressing the 3 the tail to get the two needles the second stitches of front and needles cast off process together right side inside back needle cast off cut the yarn at 5-10 cm 2 -4 froggybug 2-in-1 seahorse v3 page 5 of 16 tail chart the pale yellow lines mark the segments the darker yellow lines mark the sections they are knit on the right side row 1 3 5 and so on and purled on the wrong side row 2 4 6 and so on w means yarn in the back slip 1 purl wise yarn in the front turn the work froggybug 2-in-1 seahorse v3 page 6 of 16 back right side like the tail the back is of sections of segments the section at the head is made of 3 segments the middle and tail sections are made of 4 segments the number of stitches in the middle section remains the same all along the number of stitches of the head section increases whilst the number of stitches of the tail section decreases and vice versa like the tail the segments are marked by a vertical line of stockinette stitch increases / decreases on the curved sections are on every 2 row on the right side where the markers are knit they are a lot easier to spot the side starts with picking evenly 52 stitches from belly and13 from the tail starting from the join the tail is attached to the body while knitting the side the join between the tail and the side in shown in the yellow box chart the pale yellow lines mark the segments the darker yellow lines mark the sections they are knit on the right side row 1 3 5 and so on and purled on the wrong side row 2 4 6 and so on / \ is the join with the tail sko yf s yb slip one st purl wise knit one pass
